3.text: Cut up or trim your vegetables if necessary.

4.text: Separate your vegetables by cooking time.

5.text: Heat the water in your steamer.

6.text: Add the vegetables to the steamer.

7.text: Let the vegetables steam for a few minutes.

8.text: Pierce the vegetables with a knife or fork to see if they’re done.

9.text: Remove just the vegetables that are tender.

11.text: Choose a deep pot that can hold all the vegetables you want to steam.

12.text: Add .5 inches (1.3 cm) of water to the bottom of the pan.

13.text: Layer the vegetables into the pot based on cooking time.

14.text: Close the lid and heat the pot on medium-high heat.

15.text: Turn the heat down to low and set a timer for the recommended time.

16.text: Remove the vegetables from the heat and serve.

17.text: Put your vegetables in a microwavable bowl with a small amount of water.

18.text: Put plastic wrap over the bowl, leaving an edge turned up.

19.text: Heat the vegetables on high for around 2.5 minutes.

20.text: Eat or serve your vegetables while they’re hot.
